message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.GR, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with computational geometry problems related to convex hulls and optimization, which are typical topics in the cs.CG (Computational Geometry) sub-category. The use of optimal $O(n\log n)$ time and $O(n)$ space algorithms suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) sub-category. The paper also involves the computation and analysis of geometric structures and properties, which could fit into the cs.GR (Graphics) sub-category. The use of optimization techniques and the study of minimum/maximum values suggest that the paper may also be relevant to the cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with the computation and maintenance of geometric structures under certain conditions, which could fit into the cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-category.
